title: `rmtemp` helper uses inappropriate Windows test
body:
It checks for OSError and WindowsError, but what (also) happens is:

```
[00:04:01] ======================================================================
[00:04:01] ERROR: datalad.interface.tests.test_add_archive_content.TestAddArchiveOptions.test_add_delete_after_and_drop
[00:04:01] ----------------------------------------------------------------------
[00:04:01] Traceback (most recent call last):
[00:04:01]   File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\nose\case.py", line 385, in tearDown
[00:04:01]     try_run(self.inst, ('teardown', 'tearDown'))
[00:04:01]   File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\nose\util.py", line 471, in try_run
[00:04:01]     return func()
[00:04:01]   File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\datalad\interface\tests\test_add_archive_content.py", line 384, in teardown
[00:04:01]     rmtemp(self.annex.path)
[00:04:01]   File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\datalad\utils.py", line 332, in rmtemp
[00:04:01]     rmtree(f, *args, **kwargs)
[00:04:01]   File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\site-packages\datalad\utils.py", line 313, in rmtree
[00:04:01]     shutil.rmtree(path, *args, **kwargs)
[00:04:01]   File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\shutil.py", line 488, in rmtree
[00:04:01]     return _rmtree_unsafe(path, onerror)
[00:04:01]   File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\shutil.py", line 387, in _rmtree_unsafe
[00:04:01]     onerror(os.rmdir, path, sys.exc_info())
[00:04:01]   File "C:\Miniconda35\envs\test-environment\lib\shutil.py", line 385, in _rmtree_unsafe
[00:04:01]     os.rmdir(path)
[00:04:01] PermissionError: [WinError 32] The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process: 'C:\\Users\\appveyor\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\1\\datalad_temp_tree_p3bpg2yl'
```
